item.title: Monitoring Cloud Foundry at Scale with cf-smoke-tests suite
item.description: T-Mobile runs Pivotal Cloud Foundry platform at a very large scale (â‰ˆ100K application instances!), with a wide range of applications from across the organization spanning finance, payments, retail, and customer care. We need to not only monitor important platform KPIs, but also the most frequently exercised workflows involving critical platform components and services.

item.title: Dude where's my store? using geo distance search queries with Elasticsearch to provide store locator experience
item.description: In this post, I will walk through how we use geo distance search queries with Elasticsearch to provide “find a store” experience within our mobile application. Currently, the microservice that powers this experience in our mobile app is developed using Vert.x which is a Java based framework that is quite commonly used for developing microservices. We recently ported this service to a serverless application and decided to develop in golang.
